summary: A lot of Dany's fans think that people who speak against her hate her. I've seen people contradict it by pointing out that "no,...
body:
A lot of Dany’s fans think that people who speak against her hate her. I’ve seen people contradict it by pointing out that “no, they love Dany, they just love her as an antagonist” - mostly, those are book fans. Well, as an only-show watcher, I must say I’m neither. And I believe that most people are neither too. This post has no purpose but to humourously clarify to Dany stans that no, I don’t hate Daenerys, my feelings go more along these lines:

S1. Me @ every Daenerys scene:

S2 - S4. Me @ every Daenerys scene:

S5 - S6. Me @ every Daenerys scene:

Which is why I laughed so hard and felt so validated when, after 6 seasons of suffering through all that while other characters reactions to her words and actions were always🤩 and 😍 , Jon’s reaction to Daenerys’ being her usual self was:

blog.name: agameoftragedy
blog.title: Blame GRRM
blog.description: I used to be at least 10% more normal before I read those books. Now everything's Theon Greyjoy (and Robb Stark... and Ramsay Bolton) and everything is awful in a wonderful, wonderful way. My main blog is MzyraJ if you want more of me for some reason.

title: re Jon’s Targaryen Name
body:
Been listening to the Not a Cast podcast regarding AGOT Jon IV, where @poorquentyn and @bryndenbfishasoiaf were discussing Jon’s ‘real’ name and the probability that it may really be Aegon as per the show.

I’ve previously been resistant to the idea that it would be Aegon when Rhaegar already had a son called Aegon, but I could potentially see it in a scenario they didn’t discuss:

So we know Lyanna died in her bed of blood, with it strongly implied that this is from the childbirth, which suggests that she hadn’t given birth that long before Ned showed up. But by the time Ned showed up, Rhaegar must have been dead a little while - Robert killed Rhaegar at the Trident, then there was time for Robert and Ned to meet after the slaughter of Rhaegar‘s children and fall out over it, then Ned rode to lift the siege of Storm’s End and then rode and found Lyanna at the Tower of Joy.

Rhaegar never saw their child born. The Not a Cast guys speculated that Rhaegar may have known what was going to happen (including first son Aegon’s death) because he had contact with prophetic figures, but I think he probably just assumed from more general prophecy that his children would reflect the original Aegon and his sister-wives (the dragon having three heads), and that Lyanna would give birth to a daughter (who he may have told to name Visenya or something).

So I think the possibility is that Lyanna named their son Aegon. After all, Ned at least knew that the other Aegon was dead and the news may have reached the Tower of Joy before him, so it could have been more of a tribute to the other son rather than almost an insult. Because I also suspect that Rhaegar probably talked to her about the prophecy he was following - he needed to have three children and perhaps also that his son Aegon was going to save the world from coming darkness with the help of the other heads of the dragon. If Lyanna bought into any of that and knew that his other son Aegon was dead, she may have named this new son - the only other one Rhaegar could ever have now - Aegon to try to complete the prophecy (I suspect Ned would not be so convinced if she tried to tell him). And she may even turn out to be right.

Convert this over to the show, they skip the details, just call Jon Aegon without in-depth explanation and call it a day. Makes enough sense to me.

(Edit: This is assuming Rhaegar left any naming instructions at all, as it sounds like he was pretty confident he was going to survive the rebellion, so maybe he figured he’d decide on his return when he saw the baby, male or female.)

reblog.comment:

After all, Ned at least knew that the other Aegon was dead and the news may have reached the Tower of Joy before him, so it could have been more of a tribute to the other son rather than almost an insult. Because I also suspect that Rhaegar probably talked to her about the prophecy he was following - he needed to have three children and perhaps also that his son Aegon was going to save the world from coming darkness with the help of the other heads of the dragon. If Lyanna bought into any of that and knew that his other son Aegon was dead, she may have named this new son - the only other one Rhaegar could ever have now - Aegon to try to complete the prophecy (I suspect Ned would not be so convinced if she tried to tell him). summary: So it has come to my attention that this person ‘teufling’ has stolen my story, the Dragon Club and is uploading it onto their...
caption:
So it has come to my attention that this person ‘teufling’ has stolen my story, the Dragon Club and is uploading it onto their own Wattpad account. I have asked the person to remove it or I will get in contact with Wattpad and they’ll remove it themselves. 

I DO NOT HAVE A WATTPAD ACCOUNT, ALL MY STORIES ARE UPLOADED ONTO AO3.

I spent three months writing and crafting The Dragon Club, it’s my baby, and for it to be stolen in this way is really hurtful. 

Everyone please Reblog this and spread awareness! Create your own story don’t fucking steal mine!
